identificationModule.briefTitle: Performance of PLR as Predicting Preload Responsiveness
identificationModule.officialTitle: Evaluation of the Correct Performance and Knowledge About the Passive Leg Raise Test to Detect a Volume Reagibility in Critical Care Patients.

descriptionModule.briefSummary: We aimed to establish current practice of correct application and interpretation of the PLR in critical care patients.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The points of concern for PLR include the following: the indication and contraindication of PLR; the choice of initial position: starting from a semi-recumbent position or supine position for PLR; how to interpret and apply the changes of CO, blood pressure, and central venous pressure (CVP) to identify fluid response during PLR; and how to identify spontaneous variation and sympathetic stimulation during PLR.

interventions.name: choice of initial position
interventions.description: current practice of correct application and interpretation of the PLR in critical care patients
